newsitem.title: UK: Mideast VLCCs firm, West Africa steady.
newsitem.headline: Mideast VLCCs firm, West Africa steady.

text.p: Middle East very large crude carrier (VLCC) rates remained firm on Thursday, with rates to Japan pushing above the W60 level, brokers said.

The 280,000 tonne World Phoenix was fixed at W63.5 Mideast/Japan for Idemitsu, while voyages west fetched about W55, with the 280,000 tonne British Valour done at this rate Ras Tanura/east coast Canada for Irving.
"About 20 VLCCs have been done this week. Things are looking pretty active on the AG (Middle East) front after a dull period in April," one broker said.
The West Africa market also looked buoyant with VLCCs around W65 and 130,000 tonners (Suezmaxes)at W95.
"There's quite a lot going on in West Africa, too with rates looking firmish, depending on dates," the broker added.

The 123,000 tonne Corcovado was reported done at W95 Pennington/Pembroke for Stentex. This followed a similar fixture for Texaco on Wednesday, also Nigeria/Pembroke. Little Nigerian crude generally goes to northern Europe.
Cross-Med 80,000 tonne (Aframax) rates dipped to W102.5 from W105 while Suezmaxes were steady to slightly firmer at W92.5. Inter-U.K./Cont Aframaxes were flat at W90/92.5.
On fuel oil, 25,000 tonnes cross-Med dipped to W180 from W190 on a lack of enquiry, while it was steady in the north at W185, brokers said.
The picture on the Caribs/upcoast market was mixed, with 70,000 tonne crude cargoes dipping to W167.5 from W175 and 50,000 tonne fuel oil vessels firmer at W215 from W185.
"It's the usual supply and demand, nothing special," one broker said of this volatile market.
